Package com.android

Class Animal

java.lang.Object
com.android.Animal
public class Animal
extends Object
class where we first come across a method that takes a predicate this is a class which has the name of the species and two boolean values hop and swim if the Animal can hop, then the hop boolean value will be true, otherwise it will be false if the Animal can swim, then the swim boolean value will be true, otherwise it will be false To see video tutorial for this section of code Video tutorial For all 177 videos, which cover all the topics in this course go to Complete Course Video Tutorial
Author:
NoelF

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private boolean hop
    this boolean value will tell you if the animal can hop or not if an Animal can hop this will be true, if cannot this will be false
    private String name  
    private boolean swim
    This boolean value will tell you if the animal can swim or not if an Animal can swim this will be true, if cannot this will be false

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Animal​(String name, boolean hop, boolean swim)
    Constructor that takes a String name, a boolean hop and a boolean swim

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean canHop()
    method to test if our animal can hop this will return true or false and will print out, "can hop" if the animal can hop, and print out "cannot hop" if the Animal cannot hop
    boolean canSwim()
    method to test if our animal can swim
    static void print​(Animal animal, Predicate<Animal> trait)
    this takes as parameters a Animal object and a predicate that itslef takes in an Animal and returns true or false This method takes an Animal, which will be a fish or a rabbit, and a predicate, which will be the implementation of the boolean test(Object obj) method of the built in functional interface called predicate.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • hop

      private boolean hop
      this boolean value will tell you if the animal can hop or not if an Animal can hop this will be true, if cannot this will be false

    • swim

      private boolean swim
      This boolean value will tell you if the animal can swim or not if an Animal can swim this will be true, if cannot this will be false

    • name

      private String name

  • Constructor Details

    • Animal

      Animal​(String name, boolean hop, boolean swim)
      Constructor that takes a String name, a boolean hop and a boolean swim
      Parameters:
      name - name of the Animal
      hop - true if the animal can hop, false if not
      swim - true if the animla can swim, false if not

  • Method Details

    • canHop

      public boolean canHop()
      method to test if our animal can hop this will return true or false and will print out, "can hop" if the animal can hop, and print out "cannot hop" if the Animal cannot hop
      Returns:
      true if can swim, false if not

    • canSwim

      public boolean canSwim()
      method to test if our animal can swim
      Returns:
      true if can swim, false if not

    • print

      public static void print​(Animal animal, Predicate<Animal> trait)
      this takes as parameters a Animal object and a predicate that itslef takes in an Animal and returns true or false This method takes an Animal, which will be a fish or a rabbit, and a predicate, which will be the implementation of the boolean test(Object obj) method of the built in functional interface called predicate. the test method can take in any object, however here we have said that the object test takes in, will be a Animal. the body of the predicate will return true or false, which will be an Animal object calling the canHop() or canSwim() method
      Parameters:
      animal - a Animal object that will be used the predicate sent as a second parameter
      trait - the predicate that will use the Animal object sent as the first parameter
